meanings.definition: A person who discriminates against others based on their appearance.
meanings.sent1: The lookists at school only hang out with people who dress a certain way.
meanings.sent2: The lookists in the office always judge others by their clothes.
meanings.sent3: The lookists at the party only talked to people who wore expensive brands.
meanings.sent4: Being a lookist is like wearing glasses that only see what someone is wearing.
meanings.sent5: The lookists in the group made fun of anyone who didn't fit their style.

meanings.definition: The belief that appearance is the most important factor in judging others.
meanings.sent1: Her lookists made her think that only pretty people could be successful.
meanings.sent2: The lookists in the fashion industry prioritize looks over talent.
meanings.sent3: The lookists in the movie industry only cast actors based on their looks.
meanings.sent4: Having a lookist mindset is like seeing the world through a beauty filter.
meanings.sent5: The lookists in the group always comment on people's outfits before anything else.

meanings.definition: The act of judging or treating others unfairly based on their physical appearance.
meanings.sent1: The lookists in the school cafeteria made fun of students who didn't dress like them.
meanings.sent2: Being a lookist leads to unfair treatment of those who don't fit the mold.
meanings.sent3: The lookists in the group only invited people who fit their idea of beauty.
meanings.sent4: Lookists see people as mannequins to be judged solely on their appearance.
meanings.sent5: The lookists in the class whispered and pointed at anyone who looked different.
